runs.comm: and what a way to get Afghanistan off and rocking as he delivers a full delivery on the pads which strikes Lahiru in line. The keeper and slips know he is gone right away as the umpire doesn't hesitate to raise the finger. This was definitely in line, and hitting the back pad
allows this length delivery to go across him and through to the keeper
almost gets an inside-edge onto the stumps as Kumar looks back for the ball. Tentative stuff from the Sri Lankans so far
gets a little bit of shape back into the left-hander as he pushes at this delivery, with the ball going uppishly to the left of Dawlat in his delivery stride
driven away on the up through the covers, but locates the man inside of the ring, who is able to get on top of it

able to go for the tap-and-run as Sangakkara takes an excessively risky single to try and get to the other end, with the bowler picking up the ball and firing in a throw at the non-striker's, but is unable to hit the target. Very nervy start from the Sri Lankans
bowls a length delivery on middle and leg which is tucked away to the leg side

Shapoor is the man in Dunedin. Gets across a back of a length delivery at good pace, and carry off the deck. Dilshan, facing his very first ball, ends up tickling an edge to the keeper after this bounced a little more on him than he expected. Both openers in the shed with just eight deliveries bowled in the innings. Afghanistan off to a fantastic start!
fires in a fuller length on the pads which is clipped square off the wicket for a brace
looking to cream Shapoor through the covers, but doesn't quite get it away
defended solidly on the front foot towards the off side
rides the top of the bounce to disarm the threat of this Shapoor special outside the off stump
overpitched and going across as Sangakkara leans into a drive which reaches the fielder at mid-off
defends this length delivery going across as they look to recover after the early setbacks
safely negotiates this back of a length back towards the bowler
gets appreciable bounce and carry across the batsman, along with some movement away as Dimuth followed perilously close to the line
presents a nice, straight bat to this back of a length going across to him
short and on the pads as this is glanced away behind square to deep fine leg
short of a length and deflected away to the off side by Dimuth
tries to guide this fuller length outside of off past the fielder at point, but fails to do so
fuller one which slides down the pads as Dimuth is able to clip this away to deep midwicket, with the fielder ultimately winning the chase to the boundary in the end
short and going down middle and leg as this is fended away from within the confines of his crease

missed run out. This might be the difference between the Associates and other, major nations. Kumar Sangakkara has been given a huge life as he makes a wrong call for this tight single which he glided away to the off side. Gets halfway down the track before realising the run wasn't on. Ends up getting back when he sees Najib at backward point haring on the ball, but the fielder, who had miles to run him out, ends up firing in a throw after running a couple of steps at the batter, with this missing by just a few inches. Unbelievable let-off there as he really should have done much better
and Sangakkara makes them pay with a lofted shot over the covers to find the boundary rope
fires in a short of a length outside of off which is allowed to carry through to the keeper
safely negotiates this back of a length which cramps him for room slightly
rocks forward to defend this fuller line just outside of off
has an airy drive at this wide delivery which shapes away outside his off stump
defended away at the top of the bounce to the leg side by Dimuth
able to steer away a length delivery through midwicket as the pair run the first couple hard in order to come back for three
length delivery which is allowed to go across to the keeper
starts round the wicket as this is fended away with the angle towards the leg side
Afghanistan excellent in the field as this is caressed off the top of the bounce straight to the cover fielder, who puts in a fine, diving stop to his right to intercept it

breaks through Sangakkara's defence as Hamid Hassan has set the University Oval on fire! The Big Kahuna falls as he is beaten through the gate to this one swinging in from wide of off, with Hamid Hassan putting in a rather awkward cartwheel to finish off the celebrations
goes back to over the wicket to the right-hander as Mahela shows his years of experience with a careful, front foot defence
able to tuck away this fuller length off the pads behind square

goes back to round the wicket as Dimuth, easy as you like, is able to rock back and pull this competently through midwicket for four, which is greeted with little enthusiasm from the University Oval crowd, who are clearly pro-Afghanistan
straight and heading down middle and leg as this is flicked away for a brace through square-leg
short and angling down leg as Mahela simply helps this along with a deft flick of the blade to find the fine leg boundary
sensibly withdraws the blade to this length delivery pitched outside of off. Perfect line and length for this track really
shorter now, in the same channel, as this is allowed through to the keeper
short of a length, in the same area, as Mahela continues to demonstrate patience outside his off stump
able to glide away Hassan to the man at third man for a single
clips away this fuller length on the pads through mid-on
goes round the wicket to the left-hander as this back of a length is defended back to the bowler
short enough for Dimuth to pull, but succeeds in only finding the fielder at silly mid-on
gets this to nip in from round the wicket as Dimuth plays just inside the line. Testing stuff for the Sri Lankans
and another beauty outside of off which Dimuth fails to read as he plays yet again, dangerously close to the line
short of a length and tucked away to the leg side to end the over
they are certainly making this white ball talk as Dawlat, getting extra bounce, is able to nibble this one in from outside off as it cuts the batsman in half. That was delivered at around 140 kph
rides the bounce of this shortish length on and around off stump
length just outside off which is allowed to sail through to the keeper
length on middle and leg which is defended away softly to the leg side
fuller now on a middle to leg stump line as this is nurdled away to the close-in fielder on the leg side
negotiates this final ball of the pads to end another testing over
full and on middle as this is clipped effortlessly through midwicket
digs in a quicker one at the base of the stumps which is dug out by Mahela
short of a length outside of off which is defended by the batsman
able to glide away a single behind of square on the off side as Dimuth takes strike
able to defend this one off the back foot which angles in from wide of off
digs in a shorter one which Dimuth is able to ride the bounce off
begins with a fullish delivery outside of off which is struck away to the extra-cover fielder
full and angling in on middle as this is worked away down to mid-on
this time looks to guide it past midwicket, but the fielder is able to pounce on this rather quick, preventing the thought of a second run
squirts away this fuller length going across him towards third man
Mahela restoring some calm out there as he tucks away a single through the leg side
gets an edge to this fuller one going across, but with no slip in place, it will cost Afghanistan dearly as this runs away to the third man boundary
fuller delivery on the pads which is flicked away with ease by Mahela through backward square
shoulders arms to this length delivery outside of off
fuller one just outside of off which is driven to the short mid-off fielder
short outside off which is run away to the fielder at third man
length outside of off which tapers in from wide of the crease as Dimuth is able to get away a streaky shot via the bottom edge to find the third man boundary

Hamid Hassan is producing the good as he gets Dimuth to go after a length delivery outside of off which catches the outside edge to provide a straightforward chance to the slip, who is able to complete the catch after fumbling the first take. Hassan gets down on one knee and looks to the heavens, almost Freddie-Flintoff style. Sri Lanka four down and in a world of trouble
gets forward to this fullish length just outside of off, defending this with soft hands
just bunts away this length delivery towards the off side

Sri Lanka really struggling under the pressure as Mahela called early for this single down the leg side, with the close-in fielder picking up the ball and firing in a throw at the striker's end, with Mathews just short of his crease after he was a bit late on the call. Would have been curtains had the ball struck the timber
length on middle and off which is defended off the back foot. Not sure what he was doing on the back foot though
another one he fends away off the back foot towards the leg side, although I am not sure he should be hanging back to these deliveries
that is a more viable option as he gets the proper length of delivery to get behind off
looks to glide away a single through third man
Mathews off the mark with a slap down to sweeper cover
length on off which is defended by the batsman
drops the length now outside of off as this is run away to third man
fires a beamer at the batsman as it looks like the shoe doesn't quite fit. Given his warning, but it was surely unintentionally
content to just bunt away this fuller length on and around off
presents the straightest of blades to the bowler
defends this first, full delivery from Mirwais
this time allows the ball to sail through outside off to the keeper
rocks forward to defend this fuller one just outside of off
just opens the face to run this shortish length down to third man
slightly nervous from Mathews as he tucked away this length delivery angling in on middle and leg
and he gets to the 1000-run milestone with a push down to long on, which is lost on the Dunedin crowd as the over comes to a quiet close
floats one in on middle and leg which is directed away to the leg side by Mahela
able to get away a quick single through square-leg as Mahela is alert to the run
flatter from Nabi, along the same line, as this is steered down to long on
simply dead-bats this one flighted in from outside off
nurdles a single away on the leg side to get Mahela back on strike
tries to guide this past the leg slip, but ends up picking him out instead
gets nicely behind the line of this back of a length outside off
length outside off which is pushed away towards the covers
punched away, but not quite middled from the bat, as this eases up near extra-cover
streaks one in on middle and leg as this is flicked behind square
nicely fronts up to this length delivery angling in a touch
slapped away straight to the fielder at backward point, who takes it on the bounce
begins from round the wicket as Mathews pushes at this back of a length, with the ball ending up near the bowler's follow through
slings in a length delivery which Mathews is more than equal to
defended away by the batsman
simply content to just fend away as many deliveries as possible
steers this fuller one from round the wicket towards long off, with Mathews slightly early on it as he pushed at the delivery
short of a length and defended away to end a maiden over for Shapoor
slipping down the leg side as Mahela tickles this behind to fine leg
sends in a length delivery which shapes away as this is crashed straight to the cover fielder
this time tucked away off the pads to get Mahela back on strike
straddling down leg as this is worked away towards the square-leg fielder
short enough for Mahela to pull, and he does with consummate ease as he finds the boundary at midwicket. Was fractionally short, but he was quick to pounce on it
driven firmly now by Mahela to long off to retain strike
starts with a leg break which turns away after pitching on and around middle
slides this one on off, with this continuing down the line, as Mahela is able to cut this away through backward point
pokes out at this flatter one pitched in line of middle and leg
gets a thick outside edge which Nawroz Mangal, who is able to dive to his left at gully, is able to cut this off to save a certain boundary
this time worked away to the leg side as they steal the single
flights one in on off which is struck back to the bowler on the bounce, with Shenwari putting a full dive to his left to stop this in its tracks
fires a widish delivery, on a fuller length, which is struck away towards the fielder at cover

overpitched on the same line as Mahela leans into a crisp cover drive that races away to the boundary. Is looking very comfortable out there, which is danger signs for Afghanistan if they are to keep themselves in this contest as the innings progresses

this time goes for the dab-and-run as he is able to get to the other end despite the pressure from the close-in field. In this particular case, the fielder is unable to get a grip on the ball after feigning a throw at the other end
continues round the wicket as this is defended off the back foot by Mathews
defended from the crease as Shapoor continues to maintain a difficult line slanting into the batsman
on the front foot now to see the threat of this Shapoor special
floats one outside off which is left well alone by Mahela
gets a good stride as he steers this one straight to mid-off
content to push this one back to the same fielder
this time worked away through midwicket to get Mathews on strike
almost gives away a thick outside edge as he followed the line of this one spinning away outside off
slips the line a little closer to the body as Mathews waits on the front foot to defend
flashes hard at this short of a length, intending to get this through backward point, but ends up finding the fielder who is able to stop it. Saved a certain boundary
this time leans into a drive through the covers, with the pair completing a brace in the end
the extra bounce undoes Mahela a touch as the ball goes in the air temporarily close to the body on the off side as he looked to defend off the back foot
and Shapoor has managed to break Mahela's bat in two as a harmless defensive shot from the batsman ends the life of his trusty willow. A moment of peace for our fallen comrade
looks like he has found the middle on this one as well as he blitzes away a drive on the up through cover
whipped away off the hips as Mathews retains the strike for the next over
driven firmly by Mahela down to long off

tries to bowl a more middle to leg-stump line as Shapoor, fielding at leg slip, seems to have got himself into trouble as he points to his right leg now. Not the first time an Afghanistan player has gone down today with fitness issues...
struck straight to the man at cover

confusion in the middle almost creates another wicket for Afghanistan after Mahela, who makes the early call before stopping to get back to his end, is just about able to make it after the close-in fielder on the leg side fails to throw down to the right end. Shenwari not pleased at all by that effort
defended by the batsman
manages to pickup a single through long off to end the over
continues from round the wicket as Mathews fails to pickup a single despite hitting close to the body on the off side
doesn't quite get the carry off the deck he expected as this shorter one banged in ends up being glanced away at a comfortable height by Mathews
length outside off which is driven down to the man at mid-off
looks for the good ole tap-and-run, this time on the leg side, but can't get it away
punched away towards the cover fielder as these two are putting pressure on the close-in Afghanistan fielders, with Shenwari making a hash of this from near the wicket
going down the pads and Mahela is too classy a batsman too miss out, flicking this effortlessly through backward square to beat both deep square-leg and fine leg to the rope
eases away a single through long on

works with the angle to help this towards midwicket to earn yet another World Cup fifty. Always seems to be the batsman for Sri Lanka when they need it the most, which today certainly classifies as one of those occasions.
now Mathews gets to the other end by turning this one away to the leg side
singles are coming far too easy for Sri Lanka as Mahela finds long on this time
short and cut away through extra-cover by Mathews
lunges forward before presenting a dead, straight bat to the bowler
slides one in on middle and off, which is defended by the batsman
tries to guide this one past the mid-on fielder, but fails to do so
this time turned away off the pads towards square-leg, brings up the SL 100 as well
demonstrates his finesses with a wonderful glide through third man. Also raises the fifty-run stand between these two
looking to get it through the leg side, but ends up picking out the fielder instead
this time eased away with a step down the track to long on
rank delivery down the leg side which Mahela makes sure to punish as he paddles this through fine leg to pickup a boundary
worked straight back to the bowler by Mahela
able to unfurl a solid drive through extra-cover, but doesn't middle it
now Mathews is able to work this round the corner to pickup a brace
this time guides away a single through the vacant space at point to keep the strike
driven firmly past a sprawling Shenwari to find long off
finds mid-on with this steer through the leg side
whipped away off the pads for a single
plays this one close to the body with soft hands as the pair are able to scamper a quick single, but an overthrow allows them to take the extra
turns sharply to hit the thigh guard of Mathews as this bobbles over just behind square
lunges forward now to guide this one down to long on
tucked away square off the wicket by Mahela as they continue to rotate strike
short again from Shenwari as Mahela is preying on anything loose, getting away this paddle through fine leg to pickup four
now fetches this one from outside off before creaming this through the covers to beat the converging fielders from deep cover and long off
width and given the opportunity to attack one more, this time getting away the bowler square off the wicket on the off side
Mathews rather awkward in putting away this low full toss. Looked to go after it initially before settling for the poke down to long on
defended by Mahela from the confines of his crease
taps the ball on the leg side now to end a good over for Sri Lanka
clipped away off the pads towards deep square-leg
defended on the front foot by Mathews
punched away off the back foot, but straight to mid-on
content to just dead-bat this straighter one on middle and leg
eases away a single square off the wicket on the leg side to get Mahela on strike
slipping down the leg side as Mahela retains strike with a glance away to square-leg
starts off with a length delivery just outside off which is struck sweetly at the mid-off fielder
able to get away a streaky shot through third man, but the fielder stationed there near the boundary is able to run full tilt to his left to cut this off with a rolling dive
blitzed away on the up through to backward point
brings the hammer down to this length delivery angling in from outside off
eased away off the back foot, but straight to the short mid-on fielder
short of a length and sliding down leg as this is helped down by Angelo to fine leg
delivers a rather low, full delivery on off which is defended by the batsman
directs away this fuller one from Mirwais towards the off side
clipped uppishly towards mid-on as he got in a good stride. There was a bit of hesitation with the call, but in end both batsmen made their ends safely
mis-hits this drive towards mid-on as he looked to get it away more through long off
strides out before opening the face to this back of a length outside of off
fuller one on the pads which is flicked away straight to silly mid-on
floats in one which is drilled straight to long on
gives this plenty of air as Mahela is able to turn this away to the leg side
guided away off the back foot towards mid-on
able to get to the other end after playing this one with soft hands to the leg side
nurdles a brace through deep midwicket as the placement allows the pair to get the second run
driven authoritatively by Mahela down to long on as he moves into the 80s
defended on the front foot by Mahela as Mirwais continues to operate a wicket-to-wicket line
steered away off the back foot down to deep backward square
spears in a fuller one which is dug away towards mid-on
defended away by the batsman to the off side. No sense of urgency from Mathews here
Mirwais guilty of bowling down the leg side which is glanced by the Sri Lankan captain effortlessly to find the fine leg boundary
now goes back to tuk-tuk mode as this one is fended away to the off side
able to glide away a brace through third man
clips this fuller one straight to the man on the leg side
tucks away this back of a length on the pads towards square-leg. Brings up the 150 for them
fires in a fuller one just outside off which is negotiated safely by the batsman
squares up Mathews with this length delivery, with the resulting edge getting past backward point to help these two reach their 100-run stand
simply opens the face to this shortish length to run it down to third man
begins from round the wicket as Mahela ends up hitting this towards silly mid-on
struck sweetly to the man at mid-off, but not before these two can scamper the single they desired
short of a length and pushed towards the off side by Mathews for a single
simply runs this down with an angled face to third man
able to complete a dab-and-run outside his off stump as they continue to build towards the target
steered off the back foot down to deep cover as Mahela once again keeps the strike next over

first aggressive stroke from Mahela all day as he moves to 94 with a lofted stroke down the ground which just gets over the boundary rope at cow corner. No one really expected that, but with the Powerplay overs on now, it really is about time
looking for the blockhole as this is dug out successfully by Mahela off middle stump
driven away silkily through the covers as he presses on to 95
now Mathews is able to poke at one through the covers to get his partner back on strike
nurdles one past the bowler to his right for a single
takes this almost yorker-length delivery off middle and re-directs it towards deep midwicket with a whip of the blade
drives one past a sprawling cover fielder as a rare blunder in the field allows for this to reach the extra-cover boundary
this time eased away off the back foot as Mathews is able to get to the other end
gets nicely behind the line of this short of a length outside off
worked away off the back foot towards the off side with soft hands
steered away off the back foot behind square as he gets to the other end
defended off the back foot as Mathews sees the over to completion

and Afghanistan may have just got their man as Mahela looks to have edged a delivery from Dawlat which drifts in before appearing to catch the leading edge and going on through to the keeper behind. Given not out initially, but they want the review. Snicko reveals that the ball actually came off the top of the pad, as that was where the sound had emanated from, so the decision stays as it is. Unlucky for Afghanistan and Mahela survives on 97
defended at the top of the bounce from the relative safely of his crease
defended by the batsman to the off side
glides one away through third man to move to 98
tries to careen this one on the up through the covers, but picks out mid-off instead
shortish length on the pads which is whipped away by Mathews for one

hard to call this a chance as Mathews glides down the track before hammering this fuller one on the up at mid-off, with the ball just dying on him as he went forward to collect. The ricochet off him earned Mathews the single he wanted
works it fine through third man with the opening of the face to get to 99

Mathews looks like he has fallen just short of his ground as they attempted a quick single to this one played softly on the leg side. The close-in fielder is able to pick it up and fire in a direct hit in one fell swoop to throw down the striker's end, with the captain inches away. Ends a terrific rearguard 44  as he slams the dressing room window after storming his way back to the pavilion
strikes one on the up straight to silly mid-off. Still on 99, but that run-out has upped the anxiety a touch

and he gets the deserved single down fine leg to bring up his 19th ODI century. Has been a world-class effort after his team was reduced to a paltry 51 for 4. Cometh the hour, cometh the man. Mahela, take a bow! His fourth World Cup ton as well
turns away this fuller one from Hassan to the leg side

Hassan is the man with the golden gun as he has managed to prise out the wicket all of Afghanistan would have wanted. Gets Mahela to flick at this back of a length through third man aerially, with this hit well enough to fly comfortably to third man in the deep, who takes it safely. Big, big blow as Hassan falls to his feet and then looks to the heavens once more. Afghanistan back into this I reckon, but Sri Lanka still ahead on the equation

well, maybe not to Perera, as he gets off the mark with a hard slap to this back of a length delivered wide of off and round the wicket. Able to beat the chasing fielder from third man to the backward point boundary
now looking to clip the bowler through midwicket, but ends up getting struck high on the pad. Hassan goes for the hopeful shout, but that is exactly what is it, hopeful...
a touch fuller now as this is eased away towards mid-on
able to see out this final ball from Hassan from round the wicket, who has an extra spring in his step as he collects the ball
searching for the blockhole as this one is dug out towards the direction of long on
another nervy call for a run almost ends in a SL wicket as Jeevan calls for a run through midwicket early, before Thisara sent back his partner
unable to get away a single off the square
looks to blast away through the covers, but is only restricted to the one
driven firmly down to mid-off as the dot balls continue to mount some pressure

and Afghanistan almost manage to eke out another one as this one is struck straight to Shapoor on the full at mid-off, but this, like a previous delivery a couple of overs back, dies on the fielder as he looked to get under it. Close, but no cigar I am afraid for Afghanistan

the body language has improved ten-fold in these last couple of overs as Hassan delivers one wide of the crease, and round the wicket, with this one pushed away by the left-hander uppishly to the leg side
looking to guide this one past point, but the fielder is more than equal to the task

the ground fielding is mounting pressure on SL as Mendis fails to blaze away a drive on the up through long off, with the fielder running full tilt to his left before putting in a splendid dive to take most of the pace off the ball. The fielder at mid-on is able to come down to help him out
this time squirted away square off the wicket, but picks out point. 46 off 38 now
slower delivery going down leg which just brushes the pads as this looked like it might be called a wide, but there definitely was impact off the pad
picks up the single off the final ball as the count now moves to 45 off 36.. Shaping up to be a cracking finish here at the University Oval!
able to squeeze out a single on the off side with a bold tap-and-run
unable to guide one past the cover fielder as another dot works into Afghanistan's favour
able to force away a stroke through extra-cover as they are kept to just the two
crashed away hard through the covers as Mirwais is guilty of pitching this short. Will help ease some tension out there for the Sri Lankans
this time Thisara bludgeons away through long on, but finds the fielder straightaway
now gets it through to deep third man with a glide through the region
able to get away a single by playing this one close to the body on the off side. Gets the bruiser back on strike
and gets away with a fortuitous, outside edge which flies away over the keeper's head to the third man boundary. All valuable runs for SL, regardless of whether he meant to do it or not
this time looking to go straight over long off, but ends up hitting it on the bounce to the fielder, with this one falling again short. Has been lucky to get away with those so far...
pulled away fiercely through the leg side as Stanikzai, at midwicket, is able to stop it before firing in a throw. Can't stop them from taking the two they need though

back of a length and Thisara throws the kitchen sink at this one pitched from round the wicket. This goes high over third man, but ends up falling short of the boundary, with the ball eventually tracked before the rope
this time is able to nurdle a single to the off side and get down to the other end, with a shy at the stumps striking him on his left hamstring as he went through with the run

gets this one horribly wrong as he lets go off a full toss which arrives at perfect "swattable" length for Perera to pummel through long off, which he does with ease as this whistled over the rope. Puts SL decisively ahead on the equation now
Perera is ending this quickly for Afghanistan as he blazes away a hit through backward point, sending this to the rope after a couple of bounces with the slice
fires one in on off stump at almost yorker-length as Thisara is able to dig this one out and take the single
waits on this fuller one before drilling it down to long on to get Thisara on strike

slower ball which seems to have caught the outside edge as it went across. The batsman may have feathered one over to Zazai at keeper, but this fell short again of the gloveman. This definitely bounced on the way to the gloves as they went upstairs to check it out
ends with a lovely yorker on middle which is safely negotiated by the batsman

continues from round the wicket as Hassan goes up for the hopeful shout after Mendis appeared to have feathered an edge to the keeper. This one is given, much to the delight of Hassan and the Dunedin crowd. Mendis, though, doesn't quite agree as they go for the review. Nothing on Snicko so this will be overturned. Where would this game have been without DRS though?
this time looks to eke away a single on the off side, which they are able to do quite comfortably
crashed away through midwicket as the misfield at midwicket allows them to return for a second

spears in a yorker on middle from round the wicket which is dug out towards mid-on, and with the vacant space on offer, they are able to hustle hard to come back for the second. Excellent ODI batting there
backs away before slicing this past a converging deep point to just get over the rope. Ending very quickly here for Afghanistan
whips away this length delivery off the pads, with the two running the first one hard in order to come back in time for the second
fires one down the leg side as this is called wide by the umpire
fires in a slightly wide, full delivery which Thisara left alone, hoping to get another wide called
and Thisara finishes off the match for Sri Lanka with a thump over the covers to find the extra-cover boundary
